articles.title: About
articles.contents:
My academic interests revolve around Machine Learning, more specifically Reinforcement Learning.
More generally, I’m interested in anything related to decision-making.



Stéphane Liem Nguyen
CS student at University of Geneva 

 

 

 



University Email: first.last@etu.unige.ch


Education


Sep 2022 – present

 

MSc in Computer Science (Currently pursuing)




Faculty of Science, University of Geneva

Average grade of first year: 5.85/6
Relevant coursework: metaheuristics for optimization, data science, information system
security, information retrieval, multimedia security and privacy, modelisation and simulation of natural phenomena, introduction to computational game theory (part of selected
chapters), advanced formal tools, introduction to computational finance



Sep 2018 – Jul 2021

 

BSc degree in Computer Science




Faculty of Science, University of Geneva

Average grade: 5.55/6


Aug 2014 – Jul 2018

 

Maturité Gymnasiale




Collège Claparède (Switzerland)


Specific Option: Physics and Application of Mathematics


Complementary Option: Informatics: made two games using PyGame:

space invaders-like but has to avoid obstacles instead of shooting at them.


street-fighter-like, two players on same computer.




Work Experience


Jan 2022 – May 2022

 

Soldier




Swiss Armed Forces

Recruit School (ER) in Radio Explorer



Sep 2021 – Dec 2021

 

Auxiliaire de recherche et d’enseignement




Faculty of Science, University of Geneva

Distributed and concurrent systems (using Java), Formal languages.
Audience: 3rd and 1st year BSc of Computer Science respectively.


Feb 2021 – May 2021

 

Auxiliaire de recherche et d’enseignement (Undergraduate TA)




Collège Claparède (Switzerland)

Programmation of systems (using assembly)
Audience: 2nd year BSc of Computer Science

Projects

Advanced Formal Tools

 

PRISM case study with an investor in a simplified market (Github)


Bachelor Project

 

Implementation of learning methods inspired by reinforcement learning for symmetric rendezvous problem on the line (Github,  google colab).


Informatics Project

 

Backend development: Implementation of REST services with Java, as well as PostgreSQL databases with Docker containers (Github)



Computer Informatics Applications

 

Automatization of several time-consuming manual procedures for climate simulations: e.g
separating ocean from land using simple altitude thresholding (Gitlab)

articles.title: Learning Journey
articles.description:
Welcome to my website, curious fellow ! Are you ready to join me on my journey ?

I am Stéphane and this is my learning journey.
articles.contents:
Motto of this website
Sharing or teaching what I learn will not only help with my bad memory but also help you.
I hope my blog posts will help you, either by refreshing your memory or making you discover something new.
About Me




My academic interests revolve around Machine Learning, more specifically Reinforcement Learning.
More generally, I’m interested in anything related to decision-making.



Stéphane Liem Nguyen
CS student at University of Geneva 

 

 

 



University Email: first.last@etu.unige.ch

Selected Projects

Advanced Formal Tools

 

PRISM case study with an investor in a simplified market (Github)


Bachelor Project

 

Implementation of learning methods inspired by reinforcement learning for symmetric rendezvous problem on the line (Github,  google colab).


Informatics Project

 

Backend development: Implementation of REST services with Java, as well as PostgreSQL databases with Docker containers (Github)



Computer Informatics Applications

 

Automatization of several time-consuming manual procedures for climate simulations: e.g
separating ocean from land using simple altitude thresholding (Gitlab)
